summary: The State Department has 14 allowances that compensate employees for living overseas. For example, a post allowance helps offset the cost of living in areas more expensive than Washington, D.C., an education allowance covers the cost of sending children to school overseas, and a hardship allowance pays employees up to 35% more to serve in difficult places. In an earlier report, we focused on hardship...
title: Overseas Allowances: State Spends Almost $480 Million Annually to Compensate Employees for Costs and Hardships of Foreign Assignments
